info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... ...MARINERS ON LAKE MOULTRIE AND EASTERN LAKE MARION SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 635 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Ridgeville, or 8 miles northeast of Givhans Ferry State Park, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Moncks Corner, Saint George, Saint Stephen, Harleyville, Bonneau, Southern Lake Moultrie, Eadytown and Cross. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie and the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
